00055 #ifndef __AUDACITY_IMPORTER__
00056 #define __AUDACITY_IMPORTER__

00063 #include "../widgets/ProgressDialog.h"

00065 class TrackFactory;
00066 class Track;
00067 class Tags;

00069 class ImportFileHandle;
00070 
00071 enum
00072 {
00073    eImportSuccess,
00074    eImportCancelled,
00075    eImportFailed
00076 };
00077 
00078 class ImportPlugin
00079 {
00080 public:
00081 
00082    // Get a description of the file type this importer can import.
00083    // Examples: "Ogg Vorbis", "MP3", "Uncompressed PCM"
00084    virtual wxString GetPluginFormatDescription() = 0;
00085 
00086    // Get a list of extensions this plugin expects to be able to
00087    // import.  If a filename matches any of these extensions,
00088    // this importer will get first dibs on importing it.
00089    virtual wxArrayString GetSupportedExtensions()
00090    {
00091       return mExtensions;
00092    }
00093 
00094    bool SupportsExtension(wxString extension)
00095    {
00096       // Case-insensitive check if extension is supported
00097       return mExtensions.Index(extension, false) != wxNOT_FOUND;
00098    }
00099 
00100    // Open the given file, returning true if it is in a recognized
00101    // format, false otherwise.  This puts the importer into the open
00102    // state.
00103    virtual ImportFileHandle *Open(wxString Filename) = 0;
00104 
00105    virtual ~ImportPlugin() { }
00106 
00107 protected:
00108 
00109    ImportPlugin(wxArrayString supportedExtensions):
00110       mExtensions(supportedExtensions)
00111    {
00112    }
00113 
00114    wxArrayString mExtensions;
00115 };
00116 
00117 
00118 class ImportFileHandle
00119 {
00120 public:
00121    ImportFileHandle(const wxString & filename)
00122    :  mFilename(filename),
00123    mProgress(NULL)
00124    {
00125    }
00126 
00127    virtual ~ImportFileHandle()
00128    {
00129       if (mProgress != NULL)
00130       {
00131          delete mProgress;
00132       }
00133    }
00134 
00135    // The importer should call this to create the progress dialog and
00136    // identify the filename being imported.
00137    void CreateProgress()
00138    {
00139       wxFileName f(mFilename);
00140       wxString title;
00141 
00142       title.Printf(_("Importing %s"), GetFileDescription().c_str());
00143       mProgress = new ProgressDialog(title,
00144                                      f.GetFullName());
00145    }
00146 
00147    // This is similar to GetImporterDescription, but if possible the
00148    // importer will return a more specific description of the
00149    // specific file that is open.
00150    virtual wxString GetFileDescription() = 0;
00151 
00152    // Return an estimate of how many bytes the file will occupy once
00153    // imported
00154    virtual int GetFileUncompressedBytes() = 0;
00155 
00156    // do the actual import, creating whatever tracks are necessary with
00157    // the TrackFactory and calling the progress callback every iteration
00158    // through the importing loop
00159    virtual int Import(TrackFactory *trackFactory, Track ***outTracks,
00160                       int *outNumTracks, Tags *tags) = 0;
00161 
00162    // Return number of elements in stream list
00163    virtual wxInt32 GetStreamCount() = 0;
00164 
00165    // Return stream descriptions list
00166    virtual wxArrayString *GetStreamInfo() = 0;
00167 
00168    // Set stream "import/don't import" flag
00169    virtual void SetStreamUsage(wxInt32 StreamID, bool Use) = 0;
00170 
00171 protected:
00172    wxString mFilename;
00173    ProgressDialog *mProgress;
00174 };

00178 class UnusableImportPlugin
00179 {
00180 public:
00181    UnusableImportPlugin(wxString formatName, wxArrayString extensions):
00182       mFormatName(formatName),
00183       mExtensions(extensions)
00184    {
00185    }
00186 
00187    wxString GetPluginFormatDescription()
00188    {
00189       return mFormatName;
00190    }
00191 
00192    bool SupportsExtension(wxString extension)
00193    {
00194       return mExtensions.Index(extension, false) != wxNOT_FOUND;
00195    }
00196 
00197 private:
00198    wxString mFormatName;
00199    wxArrayString mExtensions;
00200 };
